abstract: At JPMorgan Chase, the move to split the jobs of chairman and chief executive, now held by Jamie Dimon, comes as the bank is actually prospering.
snippet: At JPMorgan Chase, the move to split the jobs of chairman and chief executive, now held by Jamie Dimon, comes as the bank is actually prospering.
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon and the 10 other directors of JPMorgan Chase take the stage in Tampa, Fla., on Tuesday, to face shareholders who can take comfort in a rising stock price and a prospering bank.

headline.main: Stockholder Power Faces Test at JPMorgan
headline.print_headline: Stockholder Power Faces Test at Chase

byline.original: By Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Susanne Craig

abstract: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive and chairman of JPMorgan Chase, is wrestling with the fallout from a multibillion-dollar trading loss.
snippet: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive and chairman of JPMorgan Chase, is wrestling with the fallout from a multibillion-dollar trading loss.
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive and chairman of JPMorgan Chase, is wrestling with the fallout from a multibillion-dollar trading loss.

headline.main: Timeline: Jamie Dimon, the Chief of Too Big to Fail

abstract: The board of Yahoo agrees to buy Tumblr for about $1.1 billion in cash. | Steven A. Cohen of SAC Capital has received a subpoena to testify before a grand jury. | Shareholders of JPMorgan Chase will have the opportunity to deliver a rebuff to Jamie Dimon. | BlackRock has become more active in recent years.
snippet: The board of Yahoo agrees to buy Tumblr for about $1.1 billion in cash. | Steven A. Cohen of SAC Capital has received a subpoena to testify before a grand jury. | Shareholders of JPMorgan Chase will have the opportunity to deliver a rebuff to Jami...
lead_paragraph: The board of Yahoo agreed on Sunday to buy the popular blogging service Tumblr for about $1.1 billion in cash, a signal of how Yahoo plans to reposition itself in the age of social media, The New York Times reports, citing people with direct knowledge of the matter. The deal, expected to be announced as soon as Monday, would surpass Facebook’s $1 billion purchase of Instagram last year.
